overview:
Kevin Partner is a Contributing Editor of PC Pro Magazine (www.pcpro.co.uk) writing on Online Business. He’s been writing for PC Pro since 1996. Kevin wrote the MagBook “How to set up an online business” for Dennis Publishing in 2009. This hugely successful and popular book has since been updated twice, modified for the US market and published around the world. It has recently been released in a Kindle edition.

Kevin is MD of Scribbleit Ltd (www.scribbleit.co.uk), a company that develops web applications using PHP, Flex, Flash and other web technologies including the WordPress framework. Scribbleit developed the Times Atlas Game for Collins Geo for the Facebook platform. Scribbleit also runs the service FixedPriceWebsite.co.uk which offers bespoke websites for small businesses at a fixed price.

Kevin is also MD of PassYourTheory Ltd (www.passyourtheory.org.uk). PassYourTheory has been providing online training for young drivers to help them pass their driving theory tests since 2005. Built on WordPress, PHP and Flash technologies, the service was relaunched in 2011 to include free membership.

Kevin is Co-founder of MakingYourOwnCandles Ltd (www.makingyourowncandles.co.uk). Created as a case study for this book, MakingYourOwnCandles has gone on to become a very successful ecommerce business which continues to grow quickly year on year.

Kevin’s programming career began with the purchase of a ZX Spectrum in 1983 with his first ever wage packet. Since learning Spectrum BASIC, Kevin mastered STOS, Visual Basic 3-6, Blitz Basic, Director Lingo and, for the past decade, the various flavours of Flash ActionScript and PHP.

Kevin joined Lloyds Bank in 1989 as a developer of interactive distance learning. In 2005, he joined Dixons Stores Group as their Product Training Manager, providing interactive training for Dixons, Currys and PC World.

In 1999, Kevin left DSG to create his first company and hasn’t looked back since.

His main skills are writing, coding, marketing and business development.
